page.title: 12HOME LIFE: POYNTINGTON (1)
page.content: {Four social groups}can be identified in this rural area: Farming people, the Retired, Professional/Craft, Self- employed and a few Commuters.{Farms are organised on a family basis with only limited outside employees. Most farmers own horses, dogs & poultry which tie them to a home base. Hunting with the Blackmore & Sparkford Vale Foxhounds, Point-to-Point races, Gym- kanas, Pony Clubs, Young Farmers Clubs, & associated social gatherings are{important events}in home life which are also shared by non-farming folk.{The church}still remains a focal point in a village like Poynington even though not all parishoners are worshippers. They like to know it's there and most will help with finance for maintenance of the building if nothing else.
